comment.author: 91829349@N00
comment._content: Presumably this gentleman: www.archerfamily.org.uk/obituary/may_wh.html If so, this isn't likely a contemporary photo, as Sir W.H. May was 65 years old in 1914

comment.author: 36645048@N00
comment._content: Must date between 1897 when he was given the MVO and 1906 when he was made a KCB. If you knew when he was given the Prussian Order of the Red Eagle you could probably narrow it further.

comment.author: 66311327@N05
comment._content: "Admiral of the Fleet Sir William Henry May GCB GCVO (1849–1930) was a Royal Navy Officer who went on to be Second Sea Lord and Chief of Naval Personnel." en.wikipedia.org/wiki/William_May_%28Royal_Navy_officer%29 See also: www.dreadnoughtproject.org/tfs/index.php/William_Henry_May Other photos of him: www.nhcra-online.org/gallery/rnofficers/may.htm m.iwm.org.uk/collections/item/object/205324788
